data.Title: Google Updates Search Algorithm to Combat Deepfakes
data.Description: Google has updated its algorithms to demote deepfake content in Google Search, making it easier to remove deepfakes and expanding "About this image" to Circle to Search and Google Lens. The search giant aims to make AI-generated or otherwise spoofed explicit content more difficult to discover and protect users from non-consensual imagery.

data.Title: Reddit Blocks Microsoft Bing From Searching Site Without Payment
data.Description: Reddit has blocked Microsoft Bing and other search engines from accessing its content unless they sign commercial agreements. The company says it doesn't want its data being used to train AI models without compensation.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Volatility Surging
data.Description: Google Search has been experiencing high levels of ranking volatility, particularly in July. This could be a sign of a new algorithm update on the horizon.

data.Title: Google Ads Reporting Outage
data.Description: Google Ads is experiencing an outage affecting ad reporting and some interfaces. Google is working on resolving the issue.

data.Title: Microsoft Bing Ad Revenue Up 19%
data.Description: Microsoft reported that its search and advertising revenue, primarily driven by Bing Ads, grew by 19% in the fourth quarter of 2024. This marks the highest quarterly growth for the segment in over two years.

data.Title: Outbrain Acquires Teads in $1 Billion Deal
data.Description: Outbrain has officially acquired Teads in a deal valued at over $1 billion. The merger creates a larger entity in the content recommendation and native advertising space.
